generalInfo:
This holiday stands out for its seamless fusion of culture and nature. You’ll not only witness Botswana’s wildlife spectacles but also form genuine bonds with its people, gaining insights into their traditions and resilience. The itinerary balances adventure with reflection, allowing time to soak in the serenity of a mokoro glide or the thrill of a lion sighting. Expert guides, many from local communities, bring each destination to life with their stories and expertise. Plus, the trip’s eco-conscious ethos ensures your travels contribute to conservation and community empowerment.
Whether you’re a culture enthusiast, a wildlife lover, or a seeker of unique adventures, the Botswana Cultural Immersion & Wildlife Experience promises a journey that captivates the senses and touches the heart.

dayInfo.description: Upon arrival at Maun Airport you will be met by our representative who will meet you and welcome you to Botswana. Overnight at Sedia Hotel

This morning after breakfast you will be start your journey towards the Okavango Delta. Discover an unforgettable adventure in Botswana’s Moremi Game Reserve, Khwai Private Reserve, or Savuti Camp, where luxury meets the African wilderness. Stay in the Large Canvas Tent (3.8m x 2.7m x 2.3m), perfect for two, featuring a queen-sized bed, wardrobe, nightstands, and en-suite bathroom, powered by solar energy for connected or unplugged comfort. For a rustic vibe, Cozy Bush Tents offer full or twin beds, luggage rack, nightstand, basin sink, and shared bathrooms. Savor hot coffee, fresh bread, and full breakfasts, chef-prepared lunches on-site or during game drives, and campfire dinners with desserts, cocktails, local beer, wine, or Chibuku. Immerse in cultural activities like mokoro canoe trips, cooking lessons, pottery, and historical tours, or thrill in wildlife adventures with full-day game drives, walking safaris, Okavango Delta boat cruises, stargazing, sunset picnics, and campfires. This journey blends Botswana’s rich heritage and stunning biodiversity, offering an intimate, eco-conscious escape for culture and nature lovers seeking the heart of Africa.

Nestled near Gweta, 290 km from Francistown and 200 km from Maun, Planet Baobab is a family-friendly camp welcoming children of all ages, blending African-inspired style with modern comfort. Choose from vibrantly painted Kalanga Huts with en-suite bathrooms or the shaded campsite, catering to various budgets. The lively ‘shebeen’-style mess area serves a delicious bar menu, while the Kalahari’s largest, coolest pool offers refreshing relief. Year-round activities include guided bush walks, traditional cattle post and village visits, encounters with friendly habituated meerkats, and expeditions to Nxai Pan. In the dry season (April 25–October 31), enjoy quad biking on the Makgadikgadi saltpans or a magical sleepout under the starlit sky. During the wet season (November 1–April 24), witness the awe-inspiring zebra and wildebeest migration. Planet Baobab delivers an authentic, adventurous escape, immersing guests in Botswana’s cultural heritage and natural wonders, perfect for families and travelers seeking a vibrant, eco-conscious retreat in the heart of the Kalahari.

Nestled in northeastern Botswana along the Chobe River, Kasane is a charming town bordering the renowned Chobe National Park, with no fences separating it from the wilderness, allowing elephants and hippos to wander freely through its streets. This gateway to adventure offers a front-row seat to Botswana’s biodiversity, where Sedudu Valley Road’s dead trees shelter elusive leopards. Explore Kasane’s cultural heritage by visiting an ancient baobab tree, once a local prison, now a historical landmark. Activities abound, including thrilling game drives through Chobe National Park to spot diverse wildlife, serene sunset cruises on the Chobe River for breathtaking views and birdwatching, and immersive visits to nearby villages to connect with local traditions. Kasane blends untamed nature with cultural richness, making it an ideal destination for travelers seeking an authentic, wildlife-packed escape in the heart of Botswana.

Victoria Falls, one of the world’s most breathtaking waterfalls, cascades along the Zambezi River, forming the border between Zambia and Zimbabwe. Stretching an impressive 1,708 meters wide, it’s the planet’s widest waterfall, easily accessible from the Zimbabwean side. The nearby town of Victoria Falls is a vibrant hub, perfect for exploring this natural wonder and its thrilling surroundings. Adventure seekers will find endless excitement with activities like scenic flights offering aerial views of the falls, microlighting for a bird’s-eye perspective, white-water rafting through roaring rapids, bungee jumping for an adrenaline rush, and kayaking along the Zambezi’s currents. Victoria Falls combines awe-inspiring beauty with heart-pounding experiences, making it an unmissable destination for travelers craving nature’s grandeur and exhilarating adventures in the heart of Zimbabwe.
